## "The Old Man and the Sea" in Social Media and Motivational Culture

While I didn't find specific evidence of a viral TikTok meme phenomenon around "The Old Man and the Sea," the search results reveal that several quotes from Hemingway's classic novella have become popular in motivational and inspirational content across social media platforms.

### Most Popular Quotes Being Shared:

**"Every day is a new day. It is better to be lucky. But I would rather be exact. Then when luck comes you are ready."** - This quote appears frequently in motivational content and quote compilations.

**"But man is not made for defeat. A man can be destroyed but not defeated."** - This is perhaps the most widely shared quote from the book, appearing across multiple motivational websites and social media platforms.

**"Let him think I am more man than I am and I will be so."**(no content)**"Why do old men wake so early? Is it to have one longer day?"**

### Motivational Content Usage:

The quotes are being shared on motivational websites that "deliver only the best motivational and inspirational quotes" and encourage sharing "on the web and social media."(no content)Sites like "Don't Give Up World" feature these quotes alongside "motivational stories, quotes, songs, videos, articles and much more inspiring content."

### Contemporary Relevance:

The themes from the book resonate with modern audiences, particularly around "a desire to reclaim something of his youth" and wanting "to show himself that he's still strong."(no content)The quotes "illustrate Hemingway's exploration of the human spirit," which makes them particularly appealing for motivational content.

While I couldn't find specific evidence of a major TikTok meme trend around "The Old Man and the Sea," the enduring popularity of these quotes in motivational social media content suggests they continue to resonate with younger audiences seeking inspiration and life wisdom from classic literature.
